job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Saginaw, MI
pros:
Without a doubt, being of service to patients and their loved ones has its rewards.

I met and worked alongside some great people over the years.

The gratification one gets working with a team that gets things done. There were nights, days I walked away thinking, "We did that!"
cons:
The Health Unit Coordinator salary isn't/wasn't great. (they allegedly increased the salary in 2020.)

Unless you want to be a RN, there isn't much opportunity for advancement, especially for African American, blacks, etc. I obtained my bachelor's in Marketing with a minor in Management, and after 13 years of service, no one deemed it worthy. They were happy to keep me as a HUC, aka, a Unit Secretary. 

I worked as a HUC for nearly 14 years and was skilled at it. New hires with less experience made only a few cents to a dollar less.

They did away with 12hr shifts for the HUCs. Therefore, HUCs are working with RNs and CNAs that are still privy to 12hr/3d per week shifts, while they work 8hr/5d per week. For most, a 3 day work week is a perk, but unfortunately they snatched it away on most units. 

Few bonuses.

pros: Great people to work with.
cons: Corporate did n0t respond quickly to elevated concerns, felt communication could have been better

review_title: Great facility for patients and staff
pros: I currently work resource as a nursing aide and I have been to every med-surge and ICU at Cooper and Harrison campuses as well as the rehab facility at Mackinaw. I also have been in Pediatrics and the RNICU. In each of these areas I could count on one hand the issues I have had with other staff in the year and a half I have worked at Covenant. I plan to stay after obtaining my nursing degree as well because I feel very supported and I enjoy going to work. The patients also routinely comment on how they could never go to any other hospital. Self-scheduling is very flexible and easy.
cons: Double rooms can get very hard to work with and it compounds a lot of issues for patients and staff.

review_title: Poor management screwed up what would have been a very nice job to be at
job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Charles, IL
pros: Lots of flexibility, opportunity to make extra income and traveling to different homes to work. Not a lot of need to physically be in the office a lot.
cons: Worked there three years with no raise or discussion of a raise. Management has a very poor style. Seems they would rather get rid of you if you did something wrong, rather  than teach you to correct your mistake, even if it is the most minor of offenses. Everybody you talk to is always wondering if this is the day they get let go. I have to wonder if the company is bleeding money, the way they are cutting staff.

job_title: Prefer Not to Say--Technical, Non Managerial in Saginaw, MI
pros: Positive work environment and room for advancement.  The management seems to share information readily and the hospital as a whole is great at communication.  Benefits are very good, especially for the region, and the hospital is family friendly.  I am proud to work for this company and anyone who does not see its merits has not been around very much--compared to other companies I've worked for, Covenant is a wonderful employer!
cons: The pay scale is lower than other hospitals in similar cities.  That may be, in part, due to the other benefits given and because Covenant is not a huge conglomerate.

review_title: More interested in corporate than providing healthcare
